intro: Ononis micrantha, commonly known as lesser burnet, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features dense clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Ononis micrantha thrives in dry, sunny environments such as meadows and rocky soils.
